Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt’s split after 12 years together has left the showbiz world in shock. 
According to reports, the 41-year-old actress, who cited irreconcilable differences, decided to end their marriage because she was "extremely upset" with the way the Moneyball star has been parenting the kids and so decided to seek joint legal custody, but not joint physical custody. 
"This decision was made for the health of the family," attorney Robert Offer also said in a statement. 
But according to a series of reports, their split could have been brewing for years. 
Despite everything, Angelina has said they they will "always be a family". Read More Angelina Jolie says she and Brad Pitt will "always be a family" despite divorce Angelina says they'll always be a family (Photo: Getty Images North America) 
Speaking to BBC World News , she said: "I don’t want to say very much about that, except to say it was a very difficult time and we are a family and we will always be a family, and we will get through this time and hopefully be a stronger family for it... 
"Many, many people find themselves in this situation. My whole family, we’ve all being through a difficult time. My focus is my children, our children... and my focus is finding this way through. 
"We are and forever will be a family. I am coping with finding a way through to make sure that this somehow makes us stronger and closer." 
But why did they split?
